$schema.description: The JSON schema reference for validation.

name.description: The name of the item. This is used to identify the item in the registry. It should be unique for your registry.

title.description: The human-readable title for your registry item. Keep it short and descriptive.

author.description: The author of the item. Recommended format: username <url>

description.description: The description of the item. This is used to provide a brief overview of the item.

dependencies.description: An array of NPM dependencies required by the registry item.

devDependencies.description: An array of NPM dev dependencies required by the registry item.

registryDependencies.description: An array of registry items that this item depends on. Use the name of the item to reference @mercurjs components and urls to reference other registries.

files.description: The main payload of the registry item. This is an array of files that are part of the registry item.

path.description: The path to the file relative to the registry root.

content.description: The content of the file. This is populated when the item is fetched.

type.description: The type of the file. This determines how the file is handled when installed.

target.description: The target path of the file. This is the destination path in the user's project.

meta.description: Additional metadata for the registry item. This is an object with any key value pairs.

docs.description: The documentation for the registry item. This is a markdown string.

categories.description: The categories of the registry item. Used for filtering and organization.
